sourcesContent:
const books = [
    { 
        id: 1, 
        author: 'Leo Tolstoy', 
        title: 'War and Peace', 
        available: true, 
        description: "An epic novel intertwining personal stories and historical events, capturing the impact of Napoleon's invasion of Russia on Russian society.",
        category: 'Historical Fiction'
    },
    { 
        id: 2, 
        author: 'Victor Hugo', 
        title: "Les Misérables", 
        available: false, 
        description: "A powerful story of redemption, justice, and the plight of the poor in 19th-century France, following the journey of Jean Valjean.",
        category: 'Historical Fiction'
    },
    { 
        id: 3, 
        author: 'Fyodor Dostoevsky', 
        title: "The Brothers Karamazov", 
        available: false, 
        description: "A philosophical exploration of faith, doubt, and morality, centered around the tumultuous lives of three brothers in Russia.",
        category: 'Philosophical Fiction'
    },
    { 
        id: 4, 
        author: 'George Orwell', 
        title: 'Animal Farm', 
        available: false, 
        description: "A satirical allegory critiquing totalitarianism, told through the story of a group of farm animals who rebel against their human owner.",
        category: 'Political Satire'
    },
    { 
        id: 5, 
        author: 'Jane Austen', 
        title: 'Pride and Prejudice', 
        available: true, 
        description: "A witty and romantic exploration of class and social standing in 19th-century England, following the lives of the Bennet sisters.",
        category: 'Romantic Fiction'
    },
    { 
        id: 6, 
        author: 'Charles Dickens', 
        title: 'Great Expectations', 
        available: false, 
        description: "The tale of a young orphan named Pip, whose journey of self-discovery is shaped by wealth, betrayal, and unrequited love.",
        category: 'Bildungsroman'
    },
    { 
        id: 7, 
        author: 'Herman Melville', 
        title: 'Moby-Dick', 
        available: true, 
        description: "A profound tale of obsession, fate, and vengeance, following Captain Ahab's relentless pursuit of the elusive white whale, Moby-Dick.",
        category: 'Adventure Fiction'
    },
    { 
        id: 8, 
        author: 'Mary Shelley', 
        title: 'Frankenstein', 
        available: true, 
        description: "A groundbreaking work of science fiction and horror, telling the story of a scientist who creates life with disastrous consequences.",
        category: 'Science Fiction'
    },
    { 
        id: 9, 
        author: 'J.R.R. Tolkien', 
        title: 'The Hobbit', 
        available: false, 
        description: "A beloved fantasy adventure that follows Bilbo Baggins on a perilous journey to reclaim a lost kingdom from a fierce dragon.",
        category: 'Fantasy'
    },
    { 
        id: 10, 
        author: 'Gabriel Garcia Marquez', 
        title: 'One Hundred Years of Solitude', 
        available: true, 
        description: "A mesmerizing tale of magical realism, chronicling the lives of the Buendía family in the mythical town of Macondo.",
        category: 'Magical Realism'
    }
]
export default books
